intro: Clutia africana, commonly known as the African clutia, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, three-lobed berries. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. The plant has been used traditionally in various herbal remedies for its potential medicinal properties.
